PageTitle: user-group bind nat instance (Value-added service policy view)
FuncDef:
The user-group bind nat instance command binds a NAT instance to a user group in a DAA service policy.
The undo user-group command restores the default configuration.
By default, a NAT instance is not bound to a user group in a DAA service policy.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a user group.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-insensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the name of a NAT instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Examples: [~HUAWEI-vas-policy-test] user-group test bind nat instance nat444
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To bind a NAT instance to a user group in a DAA service policy, run the user-group bind nat instance command. After the command is run, the device performs rate limitation and accounting on NAT/DS-Lite user traffic based on different services in a distributed NAT/DS-Lite scenario.
Prerequisites
A NAT instance has been created using the nat instance command.A user group has been created using the user-group command.

Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
